column3: Negotiating means getting the best of your opponent.
I did a movie called Marathon Man and it was one of my best memories.

The important thing is to learn a lesson every time you lose. Life is a learning process and you have to try to learn what's best for you. Let me tell you, life is not fun when you're banging your head against a brick wall all the time.

The most excellent and divine counsel, the best and most profitable advertisement of all others, but the least practiced, is to study and learn how to know ourselves. This is the foundation of wisdom and the highway to whatever is good.
You've got to be the best person you can be in your life.
The trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.
The best cure for insomnia is to get a lot of sleep.
Of all the home remedies, a good wife is best.
He who keeps his cool best wins.
Let none of us delude himself by supposing that honesty is always the best policy. It is not.
Reading - the best state yet to keep absolute loneliness at bay.
The best theology would need no advocates; it would prove itself.
I'd like to think the best of me was still hiding up in my sleeve.
There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts.
The best defense against usurpatory government is an assertive citizenry.
The best way to get along is never to forgive an enemy or forget a friend.
Set up another case bartender! The best thing for a case of nerves is a case of Scotch.
The purpose of psychology is to give us a completely different idea of the things we know best.
It's a matter of taking the side of the weak against the strong, something the best people have always done.
In this world you've just got to hope for the best and prepare for the worst and take whatever God sends.
As you become more clear about who you really are, you'll be better able to decide what is best for you - the first time around.
From now until the end of time no one else will ever see life with my eyes, and I mean to make the best of my chance.
The prizes go to those who meet emergencies successfully. And the way to meet emergencies is to do each daily task the best we can.
Like all parents, my husband and I just do the best we can, hold our breath and hope we've set aside enough money for our kid's therapy.

Can a woman become a genius of the first class? Nobody can know unless women in general shall have equal opportunity with men in education, in vocational choice, and in social welcome of their best intellectual work for a number of generations.
Progress, of the best kind, is comparatively slow. Great results cannot be achieved at once; and we must be satisfied to advance in life as we walk, step by step.
